'a0Dear, dear, itdoesseemlikeIcouldeatyouup! 'a0Children, it'syourcousinTom!--tellhimhowdy.'94Buttheyduckedtheirheads, andputtheirfingersintheirmouths, andhidbehindher. 'a0Sosherunon:

'93Yes'm--she--'94

CHAPTERXXXV.

CHAPTERXXXVI.

CHAPTERXXXIX.

that'swhatIthinkabouthim.'94Somebodysays:


'93Well, itsoundsverygood, doctor, I'mobleegedtosay.'94Thentheotherssoftenedupalittle, too, andIwasmightythankfultothatolddoctorfordoingJimthatgoodturn; andIwasgladitwasaccordingtomyjudgmentofhim, too; becauseIthoughthehadagoodheartinhimandwasagoodmanthefirsttimeIseehim. 'a0ThentheyallagreedthatJimhadactedverywell, andwasdeservingtohavesomenoticetookofit, andreward. 'a0Soeveryoneofthempromised, rightoutandhearty, thattheywouldn'tcusshimnomore.


Thentheycomeoutandlockedhimup. 'a0Ihopedtheywasgoingtosayhecouldhaveoneortwoofthechainstookoff, becausetheywasrottenheavy, orcouldhavemeatandgreenswithhisbreadandwater; buttheydidn'tthinkofit, andIreckoneditwarn'tbestformetomixin, butIjudgedI'dgetthedoctor'syarntoAuntSallysomehoworotherassoonasI'dgotthroughthebreakersthatwaslayingjustaheadofme--explanations, Imean, ofhowIforgottomentionaboutSidbeingshotwhenIwastellinghowhimandmeputinthatdrattednightpaddlingaroundhuntingtherunawaynigger.


ButIhadplentytime. 'a0AuntSallyshestucktothesick-roomalldayandallnight, andeverytimeIseeUncleSilasmooningaroundIdodgedhim.


NextmorningIheardTomwasagooddealbetter, andtheysaidAuntSallywasgonetogetanap. 'a0SoIslipstothesick-room, andifIfoundhimawakeIreckonedwecouldputupayarnforthefamilythatwouldwash. Buthewassleeping, andsleepingverypeaceful, too; andpale, notfire-facedthewayhewaswhenhecome. 'a0SoIsetdownandlaidforhimtowake. 'a0InabouthalfanhourAuntSallycomesglidingin, andthereIwas, upastumpagain! 'a0Shemotionedmetobestill, andsetdownbyme, andbeguntowhisper, andsaidwecouldallbejoyfulnow, becauseallthesymptomswasfirst-rate, andhe'dbeensleepinglikethatforeversolong, andlookingbetterandpeacefullerallthetime, andtentoonehe'dwakeupinhisrightmind.


Sowesettherewatching, andbyandbyhestirsabit, andopenedhiseyesverynatural, andtakesalook, andsays:


'93Hello!--why, I'mat_home_! 'a0How'sthat? 'a0Where'stheraft?'94


'93It'sallright,'94Isays.


'93And_Jim_?'94


'93Thesame,'94Isays, butcouldn'tsayitprettybrash. 'a0Buthenevernoticed, butsays:


'93Good! 'a0Splendid! 'a0_Now_we'reallrightandsafe! DidyoutellAunty?'94Iwasgoingtosayyes; butshechippedinandsays:  '93Aboutwhat, Sid?'94


'93Why, aboutthewaythewholethingwasdone.'94


'93Whatwholething?'94


'93Why, _the_wholething. 'a0Thereain'tbutone; howwesettherunawayniggerfree--meandTom.'94


'93Goodland! 'a0Settherun--What_is_thechildtalkingabout! 'a0Dear, dear,

outofhisheadagain!'94


'93_No_, Iain'toutofmy_head_; IknowallwhatI'mtalkingabout. 'a0We_did_sethimfree--meandTom. 'a0Welaidouttodoit, andwe_done_it.

'a0Andwedoneitelegant, too.'94 'a0He'dgotastart, andshenevercheckedhimup, justsetandstaredandstared, andlethimclipalong, andIseeitwarn'tnousefor_me_toputin.  '93Why, Aunty, itcostusapowerofwork--weeksofit--hoursandhours, everynight, whilstyouwasallasleep. Andwehadtostealcandles, andthesheet, andtheshirt,

andyourdress, andspoons, andtinplates, andcase-knives, andthewarming-pan, andthegrindstone, andflour, andjustnoendofthings,

andyoucan'tthinkwhatworkitwastomakethesaws, andpens, andinscriptions, andonethingoranother, andyoucan'tthink_half_thefunitwas. 'a0Andwehadtomakeupthepicturesofcoffinsandthings,

andnonnamouslettersfromtherobbers, andgetupanddownthelightning-rod, anddigtheholeintothecabin, andmadetheropeladderandsenditincookedupinapie, andsendinspoonsandthingstoworkwithinyourapronpocket--'94


'93Mercysakes!'94


'93--andloadupthecabinwithratsandsnakesandsoon, forcompanyforJim; andthenyoukeptTomheresolongwiththebutterinhishatthatyoucomenearspilingthewholebusiness, becausethemencomebeforewewasoutofthecabin, andwehadtorush, andtheyheardusandletdriveatus, andIgotmyshare, andwedodgedoutofthepathandletthemgoby, andwhenthedogscometheywarn'tinterestedinus, butwentforthemostnoise, andwegotourcanoe, andmadefortheraft, andwasallsafe, andJimwasafreeman, andwedoneitallbyourselves, and_wasn't_itbully, Aunty!'94


'93Well, Ineverheardthelikesofitinallmyborndays! 'a0Soitwas_you_, youlittlerapscallions, that'sbeenmakingallthistrouble,

andturnedeverybody'switscleaninsideoutandscaredusallmosttodeath. 'a0I'veasgoodanotionaseverIhadinmylifetotakeitouto' youthisveryminute. 'a0Tothink, hereI'vebeen, nightafternight,

a--_you_justgetwellonce, youyoungscamp, andIlayI'lltantheOldHarryouto' botho' ye!'94ButTom, he_was_soproudandjoyful, hejust_couldn't_holdin,

andhistonguejust_went_it--shea-chippingin, andspittingfireallalong, andbothofthemgoingitatonce, likeacatconvention; andshesays:


'93_Well_, yougetalltheenjoymentyoucanoutofit_now_, formindItellyouifIcatchyoumeddlingwithhimagain--'94


'93Meddlingwith_who_?'94 'a0Tomsays, droppinghissmileandlookingsurprised.


'93With_who_? 'a0Why, therunawaynigger, ofcourse. 'a0Who'dyoureckon?'94Tomlooksatmeverygrave, andsays:


'93Tom, didn'tyoujusttellmehewasallright? 'a0Hasn'thegotaway?'94


'93_Him_?'94saysAuntSally; '93therunawaynigger?  'Deedhehasn't.

'a0They'vegothimback, safeandsound, andhe'sinthatcabinagain,

onbreadandwater, andloadeddownwithchains, tillhe'sclaimedorsold!'94Tomrosesquareupinbed, withhiseyehot, andhisnostrilsopeningandshuttinglikegills, andsingsouttome:


'93Theyhain'tno_right_toshuthimup! 'a0SHOVE!--anddon'tyouloseaminute. 'a0Turnhimloose! heain'tnoslave; he'sasfreeasanycreturthatwalksthisearth!'94


'93What_does_thechildmean?'94


'93ImeaneverywordI_say_, AuntSally, andifsomebodydon'tgo, _I'll_go. I'veknowedhimallhislife, andsohasTom, there. 'a0OldMissWatsondiedtwomonthsago, andshewasashamedsheeverwasgoingtosellhimdowntheriver, and_said_so; andshesethimfreeinherwill.'94


'93Thenwhatonearthdid_you_wanttosethimfreefor, seeinghewasalreadyfree?'94


'93Well, that_is_aquestion, Imustsay; andjustlikewomen! 'a0Why,

Iwantedthe_adventure_ofit; andI'dawadedneck-deepinbloodto--goodnessalive, _AuntPolly!_'94Ifshewarn'tstandingrightthere, justinsidethedoor, lookingassweetandcontentedasanangelhalffullofpie, IwishImaynever!


AuntSallyjumpedforher, andmosthuggedtheheadoffofher, andcriedoverher, andIfoundagoodenoughplaceformeunderthebed,

foritwasgettingprettysultryforus, seemedtome. 'a0AndIpeepedout, andinalittlewhileTom'sAuntPollyshookherselflooseandstoodtherelookingacrossatTomoverherspectacles--kindofgrindinghimintotheearth, youknow. 'a0Andthenshesays:


'93Yes, you_better_turny'rheadaway--IwouldifIwasyou, Tom.'94


'93Oh, dearyme!'94saysAuntSally; '93_Is_hechangedso? 'a0Why, thatain't_Tom_, it'sSid; Tom's--Tom's--why, whereisTom? 'a0Hewashereaminuteago.'94


'93Youmeanwhere'sHuck_Finn_--that'swhatyoumean! 'a0IreckonIhain'traisedsuchascampasmyTomalltheseyearsnottoknowhimwhenI_see_him. 'a0That_would_beaprettyhowdy-do. Comeoutfromunderthatbed, HuckFinn.'94SoIdoneit. 'a0Butnotfeelingbrash.


AuntSallyshewasoneofthemixed-upest-lookingpersonsIeversee--exceptone, andthatwasUncleSilas, whenhecomeinandtheytolditalltohim. 'a0Itkindofmadehimdrunk, asyoumaysay, andhedidn'tknownothingatalltherestoftheday, andpreachedaprayer-meetingsermonthatnightthatgavehimarattlingruputation, becausetheoldestmanintheworldcouldn'taunderstoodit. 'a0SoTom'sAuntPolly,

shetoldallaboutwhoIwas, andwhat; andIhadtoupandtellhowIwasinsuchatightplacethatwhenMrs. PhelpstookmeforTomSawyer--shechippedinandsays, '93Oh, goonandcallmeAuntSally, I'musedtoitnow, and 'tain'tnoneedtochange'94--thatwhenAuntSallytookmeforTomSawyerIhadtostandit--therewarn'tnootherway, andIknowedhewouldn'tmind, becauseitwouldbenutsforhim, beingamystery, andhe'dmakeanadventureoutofit, andbeperfectlysatisfied. 'a0Andsoitturnedout, andheletontobeSid, andmadethingsassoftashecouldforme.


AndhisAuntPollyshesaidTomwasrightaboutoldMissWatsonsettingJimfreeinherwill; andso, sureenough, TomSawyerhadgoneandtookallthattroubleandbothertosetafreeniggerfree! andIcouldn'teverunderstandbefore, untilthatminuteandthattalk, howhe_could_helpabodysetaniggerfreewithhisbringing-up.


Well, AuntPollyshesaidthatwhenAuntSallywrotetoherthatTomand_Sid_hadcomeallrightandsafe, shesaystoherself:


'93Lookatthat, now! 'a0Imighthaveexpectedit, lettinghimgooffthatwaywithoutanybodytowatchhim. 'a0SonowIgottogoandtrapseallthewaydowntheriver, elevenhundredmile, andfindoutwhatthatcreetur'supto_this_time, aslongasIcouldn'tseemtogetanyansweroutofyouaboutit.'94


'93Why, Ineverheardnothingfromyou,'94saysAuntSally.


'93Well, Iwonder! 'a0Why, IwroteyoutwicetoaskyouwhatyoucouldmeanbySidbeinghere.'94


'93Well, Inevergot 'em, Sis.'94AuntPollysheturnsaroundslowandsevere, andsays:


'93You, Tom!'94


'93Well--_what_?'94hesays, kindofpettish.


'93Don'tyouwhat_me_, youimpudentthing--handoutthemletters.'94


'93Whatletters?'94


'93_Them_letters. 'a0Ibebound, ifIhavetotakea-holtofyouI'll--'94


'93They'reinthetrunk. 'a0There, now. 'a0Andthey'rejustthesameastheywaswhenIgotthemoutoftheoffice. 'a0Ihain'tlookedintothem, Ihain'ttouchedthem. 'a0ButIknowedthey'dmaketrouble, andIthoughtifyouwarn'tinnohurry, I'd--'94


'93Well, you_do_needskinning, thereain'tnomistakeaboutit. 'a0AndIwroteanotheronetotellyouIwascoming; andIs'posehe--'94


'93No, itcomeyesterday; Ihain'treadityet, but_it's_allright, I'vegotthatone.'94Iwantedtooffertobettwodollarsshehadn't, butIreckonedmaybeitwasjustassafetonotto. 'a0SoIneversaidnothing.





CHAPTERTHELASTTHEfirsttimeIcatchedTomprivateIaskedhimwhatwashisidea, timeoftheevasion?--whatitwashe'dplannedtodoiftheevasionworkedallrightandhemanagedtosetaniggerfreethatwasalreadyfreebefore?

Andhesaid, whathehadplannedinhisheadfromthestart, ifwegotJimoutallsafe, wasforustorunhimdowntheriverontheraft, andhaveadventuresplumbtothemouthoftheriver, andthentellhimabouthisbeingfree, andtakehimbackuphomeonasteamboat, instyle,

andpayhimforhislosttime, andwritewordaheadandgetoutalltheniggersaround, andhavethemwaltzhimintotownwithatorchlightprocessionandabrass-band, andthenhewouldbeahero, andsowouldwe. 'a0ButIreckoneditwasaboutaswellthewayitwas.


WehadJimoutofthechainsinnotime, andwhenAuntPollyandUncleSilasandAuntSallyfoundouthowgoodhehelpedthedoctornurseTom,

theymadeaheapoffussoverhim, andfixedhimupprime, andgivehimallhewantedtoeat, andagoodtime, andnothingtodo. 'a0Andwehadhimuptothesick-room, andhadahightalk; andTomgiveJimfortydollarsforbeingprisonerforussopatient, anddoingitupsogood,

andJimwaspleasedmosttodeath, andbustedout, andsays:


'93Dah, now, Huck, whatItellyou?--whatItellyouupdahonJacksonislan'? 'a0I_tole_youIgotahairybreas', enwhat'sdesignunit; enI_tole_youIbenrichwunst, engwinetertoberich_agin_; enit'scometrue; enheahsheis! 'a0_dah_, now! doan' talkto_me_--signsis_signs_, mineItellyou; enIknowedjis' 'swell 'atI 'uzgwineterberichaginasI'sa-stannin' heahdisminute!'94AndthenTomhetalkedalongandtalkedalong, andsays, le'sallthreeslideoutofhereoneofthesenightsandgetanoutfit, andgoforhowlingadventuresamongsttheInjuns, overintheTerritory, foracoupleofweeksortwo; andIsays, allright, thatsuitsme, butIain'tgotnomoneyfortobuytheoutfit, andIreckonIcouldn'tgetnonefromhome, becauseit'slikelypap'sbeenbackbeforenow, andgotitallawayfromJudgeThatcheranddrunkitup.


'93No, hehain't,'94Tomsays; '93it'sallthereyet--sixthousanddollarsandmore; andyourpaphain'teverbeenbacksince. 'a0Hadn'twhenIcomeaway, anyhow.'94Jimsays, kindofsolemn:


'93Heain'ta-comin' backnomo', Huck.'94Isays:


'93Why, Jim?'94


'93Nemminewhy, Huck--butheain'tcomin' backnomo.'94ButIkeptathim; soatlasthesays:


'93Doan' you 'memberdehousedatwasfloat'ndownderiver, endeywuzamanindah, kiveredup, enIwentinenunkiveredhimanddidn' letyoucomein? 'a0Well, den, youkingityo' moneywhenyouwantsit, kasedatwuzhim.'94Tom'smostwellnow, andgothisbulletaroundhisneckonawatch-guardforawatch, andisalwaysseeingwhattimeitis, andsothereain'tnothingmoretowriteabout, andIamrottengladofit, becauseifI'daknowedwhatatroubleitwastomakeabookIwouldn'tatackledit,

andain'ta-goingtonomore. 'a0ButIreckonIgottolightoutfortheTerritoryaheadoftherest, becauseAuntSallyshe'sgoingtoadoptmeandsivilizeme, andIcan'tstandit. 'a0Ibeentherebefore.
